text: after three years of calm the streets of
Bangkok are once again the stage for
noisy protests as before they sent her
on one man Jackson shinawatra former
prime minister now stood by a coup seven
years ago and still living in exile
three and a half years ago it was his
supporters outraged by what they saw as
the undemocratic means used to keep him
and his party out of power who occupied
Bangkok that ended in tragedy when the
army used live gunfire to clear them out
more than 90 died and many more people
were jailed today mr. taxon sister
Yingluck is prime minister and his party
is in power once again the amnesty they
proposed was initially intended only to
help ordinary people charged in
connection with past clashes but at the
last minute the amnesty bill was
dramatically expanded to include all
charges related to political conflicts
dating back nine years that could result
in the two year jail sentence given in
ad sent here to mr. taxon being
overturned opening the way for him to
return to thailand his supporters have
always said his conviction was
politically motivated and that he should
be allowed to come back the party and
many people in Thailand would like him
to come back because he SAT high his
atty intestacy has done many good things
to the country literally a lot of people
would like him to come back but for the
opposition Democrats and many other ties
such a sweeping amnesty is unacceptable
it would close the book on a long list
of abuses which have yet to be
investigated and bring back a political
figure who while undeniably popular
could still they fear dangerously
dominate this country's fragile
political system Jonathan hit BBC News
Bangkok
